svcproc.title: Crankcase and Cylinder Head Coolant Flow
svcproc.para: Coolant flows through passages in the front cover to the left and right sides of the crankcase. Coolant flows through the front of both sides of the crankcase, evenly distributing coolant around the cylinders, and exits the crankcase flowing up to the cylinder heads.
Coolant flows from the rear of the cylinder heads to the front, exits down a passage in the crankcase, and returns to the front cover.
For increased performance in cold weather, an optional power cord can be connected to the coolant heater installed in the crankcase.
